refnamediv.refpurpose: Determines the range of dispersion of the mean.

listitem.para: statistical confidence level (%) as a string or the level of significance (alpha) as a decimal value, "95%", "99%", "99.9%" or 0.05, 0.01, 0.001 resp (see examples).
trust area, range of dispersion of the mean.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: "ST_trustarea" determine the range of dispersion of the mean. It describes the quality of the mean and indicates the range of dispersion of the mean and not of the raw values as the stray area does.
E.g. if trustval = 1.4 at p = 95% with a mean = 10,0 the mean for the whole population will stray with a confidence of 95% at about 10.0 +/- 1.4.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: V = [6 8 14 12 5 15]; mean(V) // = 10. trustval1 = ST_trustarea(V, "95%") // = 4.4514 trustval2 = ST_trustarea(V, 0.05) // = 4.4514

refsection.title: Bibliography
refsection.para: R. Kaiser, G. Gottschalk; "Elementare Tests zur Beurteilung von Meßdaten", BI Hochschultaschenbücher, Bd. 774, Mannheim 1972.
